duck: craps definition: a gambling game played with two dice.

Craps principle - In probability theory, the craps principle is a theorem about event probabilities under repeated iid trials.
Craps is a dice game in which the players make wagers on the outcome of the roll, or a series of rolls, of a pair of dice.
Boxcars (slang) - Boxcars is the outcome of rolling the dice in a game of craps and getting a 6 on each die.
Floating craps - The term floating craps refers to an illegal operation of the dice game craps.

Illusion of control - The illusion of control is the tendency for people to overestimate their ability to control events, for instance to feel that they control outcomes that they demonstrably have no influence over.
Craps is a dice game in which the players make wagers on the outcome of the roll, or a series of rolls, of a pair of dice.

wiki.text:
'Craps' is a dice game in which the players make wagers on the outcome of the
roll, or a series of rolls, of a pair of dice. Players may wager money against
each other (street craps, also known as shooting dice or rolling dice) or a bank
(casino craps, also known as table craps). Because it requires little equipment,
street craps can be played in informal settings.
wiki.title: craps
headings: Rules of play against a bank or casino
Rules of play against other players
